name: Rahima Foundation
mission: Rahima International Foundation strives to feed the hungry, assist the financially insecure, and support students in their educational journey.
theoryOfChange: Rahima Foundation states it provides a safety net to low-income community members through monthly groceries, rent and utility assistance, hot meals, and educational support to address basic needs and food insecurity.

components.evidence: Accepts zakat (+2); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

alignment.rationale: Alignment 37/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, humanitarian cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Build working capital reserves to 1-3 months of operating expenses
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes for 3+ years
components.name: Evidence & Outcomes

judge_issues.message: The impact rationale mentions a moderate cost per beneficiary but the actual cost per beneficiary is $14222.07, which is high for a humanitarian organization. This should be reflected in the rationale.

The risk deduction of -6 is significant and should be more explicitly mentioned in the amal_score_rationale. The rationale only mentions stellar financial efficiency and high alignment with humanitarian causes, but doesn't highlight the risks that significantly lowered the score.
Evaluation source domain 'vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com' is not a known trusted evaluator
Evaluation source domain 'vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com' is not a known trusted evaluator
Evaluation source domain 'vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com' is not a known trusted evaluator
Zakat acceptance claimed but no evidence, URL, or direct verification provided

risks.risk_summary: Key concern: Board too small: 2 members

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: RAHIMA INTERNATIONAL FOUNDATION earns 52/100 due to strong alignment and moderate impact, with zakat compliance (significant risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: Found 'donate zakat' on https://www.rahima.org/zakat-rahima (https://www.rahima.org/zakat-rahima); Website mission/programs mention zakat

all_citations.claim: Rahima International Foundation holds a Charity Navigator score of 96.0/100 and maintains a program expense ratio of 95.3%.
The organization reported total revenue of $4,006,022 and holds 65.0 months of working capital.
The foundation is Zakat-eligible and provides various donation options for humanitarian relief.
The charity engages the community through volunteer opportunities to support its food distribution and educational missions.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a moderate overall score due to its stellar financial efficiency and high alignment with humanitarian causes, balanced by a need for more robust external impact data.
areas_for_improvement: Enhancing public disclosure of third-party impact evaluations to improve direct service metrics.
Increasing transparency regarding specific cost-per-beneficiary breakdowns across different program types.

dimension_explanations.alignment: Alignment is high as the charity directly addresses urgent humanitarian needs and offers clear Zakat-eligibility for Muslim donors [3]. Its long-standing commitment to feeding the hungry and supporting students provides a strong track record for donors seeking high-fit charitable opportunities [4].
dimension_explanations.impact: The foundation demonstrates strong financial health with a Charity Navigator score of 96.0/100 and total revenue of $4,006,022 [1][2]. While the organization maintains a high program expense ratio of 95.3%, the impact score reflects a moderate cost per beneficiary and a need for more comprehensive evidence of long-term program effectiveness [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: Rahima International Foundation is a high-impact humanitarian organization dedicated to alleviating hunger and supporting educational advancement for the financially insecure.
strengths: Exceptional program expense ratio of 95.3%, ensuring the vast majority of funds reach those in need.
Highly efficient fundraising operations with a cost of $0.00 per $1 raised.
Robust financial stability with 65.0 months of working capital.
baseline_narrative.summary: Based in California, Rahima International Foundation operates critical community programs including food distribution, soup kitchens, and meat collection to combat local food insecurity [1][2]. The organization is recognized as Zakat-eligible, providing a trusted channel for donors to fulfill their religious obligations while supporting vulnerable populations [3].

all_citations.claim: food distribution, soup kitchens, and meat collection
all_citations.quote: Programs: Food Distribution, Soup Kitchen, Meat Collection, Zakat

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a moderate overall score due to its stellar financial efficiency and high alignment with humanitarian causes, balanced by a need for more robust external impact data.

areas_for_improvement.context: The organization currently operates with only <cite id="1">2 board members</cite>, which falls below the recommended minimum for robust oversight.
With <cite id="1">65.0 months of working capital</cite>, the organization holds reserves far exceeding the typical 1-3 month benchmark for efficiency.

bbb_assessment.summary: Maintains high accountability standards with audited financials and clear mission alignment.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization maintains high transparency ratings, which partially mitigates the oversight risks associated with a small board.
risk_factors: <cite id="1">Working capital exceeding 5 years of expenses</cite>
case_against.summary: The primary concerns involve <cite id="1">governance risks</cite> due to a small board and <cite id="1">excessive capital reserves</cite> that could be more actively deployed.

confidence.notes: Financial data is highly consistent across sources.

alignment.explanation: Strong fit for Muslim donors as a <cite id="3">zakat-eligible organization</cite> serving the fuqara asnaf in a high-urgency humanitarian space.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust this charity due to its <cite id="1">96.0/100 from Charity Navigator rating</cite> and its <cite id="3">33-year history</cite> of consistent operation.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the foundation should <cite id="1">expand its board of directors</cite> beyond the current two members to enhance independent oversight.

impact.explanation: Operations are highly direct, with a <cite id="2">100.0% program ratio</cite> and a <cite id="3">direct service delivery model</cite> for food and zakat distribution.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="1">seeking external evaluations</cite> to verify the long-term outcomes of its $14,222 per-beneficiary spending.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Internal tracking with clear theory of change

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Supports major international relief agencies through domestic chapters

rich_narrative.headline: Rahima International Foundation is a high-impact humanitarian organization dedicated to alleviating hunger and supporting educational advancement for the financially insecure.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who prioritize extreme financial efficiency and want to support a long-standing, zakat-eligible institution with deep roots in the California Muslim community.
donor_motivations: Want 95.3% of their donation to go directly to programs
Value long-term organizational stability and massive financial reserves
Seeking to fulfill zakat obligations through local food security initiatives
Prefer organizations with zero fundraising overhead
giving_considerations: The organization has a very small leadership circle
Financial reserves are high, suggesting the charity is not in an immediate cash crisis
Impact is focused on high-cost-per-beneficiary direct services
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking a large, multi-national board of directors or those who prefer charities with low cash reserves that 'spend down' every dollar immediately.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects a clear theory of change and internal tracking, but a lack of independent, third-party impact evaluations.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The foundation combats poverty by providing immediate nutritional support (food/meat) and financial assistance (zakat) to stabilize households.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that the high cost per beneficiary translates into long-term poverty reduction.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: While the charity is stable, its <cite id="2">revenue has declined by 5.2%</cite> over three years, suggesting a need for new donor engagement.

organizational_capacity.geographic_reach: Northern California (San Mateo, Alameda, Santa Clara counties)

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by a <cite id="2">100.0% program ratio</cite>, which is significantly higher than the <cite id="1">peer median of 89.7%</cite>.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar humanitarian focus and organizational scale
similar_organizations.name: KinderUSA

strengths.detail: The organization maintains a <cite id="2">95.3% program expense ratio</cite> and a <cite id="1">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised</cite>.
Operating since <cite id="3">1993</cite>, the foundation has a 33-year track record of service in the <cite id="3">San Francisco Bay Area</cite>.
The foundation holds a <cite id="1">96/100 Accountability & Finance score</cite> and a Gold Seal of Transparency from Candid.

strengths_deep_dive: Rahima International Foundation demonstrates an unusual level of fiscal leaness, reporting that <cite id="2">zero dollars were spent on fundraising</cite> in 2023 despite raising over $4 million. This efficiency is paired with a massive reserve of <cite id="1">65.0 months of working capital</cite> in working capital, which is significantly higher than the industry standard and ensures the organization can survive prolonged economic downturns. Their impact is further validated by a <cite id="1">perfect 100/100 score in Culture & Community</cite> from Charity Navigator, reflecting strong internal organizational health.
rich_narrative.summary: founded in 1993, Rahima International Foundation is a California-based humanitarian organization that has spent over three decades addressing food insecurity and educational needs. The organization operates with a high degree of financial efficiency, maintaining a <cite id="1">96/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>. Their primary operations center on direct service delivery, including <cite id="3">food distribution, soup kitchens, and meat collection</cite> for the financially insecure in Northern California. In the 2023 fiscal year, the foundation reported <cite id="2">$4,006,022 in total revenue</cite>, with a remarkable <cite id="2">95.3% program expense ratio</cite>, indicating that all reported expenses were directed toward its core mission. Beyond local services, the foundation also engages in significant grantmaking, including a <cite id="2">$1,000,000 domestic grant to USA FOR UNHCR</cite> to support broader humanitarian efforts. As a <cite id="3">zakat-eligible institution</cite>, it serves as a critical vehicle for Muslim donors to fulfill religious obligations through programs that support the poor (fuqara) and needy (masakin). While the organization maintains <cite id="1">65.0 months of working capital</cite>, reflecting extreme long-term stability, its governance structure is lean, currently operating with a <cite id="1">two-member board of directors</cite>.
